Starting my career in web development, I've worked across a span of engineering and project management duties. I am strong in cross-functional roles where I can provide insights and mentoring to junior people and clear communication with peers and seniors. Working through major features and smaller projects, I'm comfortable developing relationships with stake-holders to ease scope-creep and help provide understanding of technical details. I've also worked with complex projects, guiding with processes and methodologies from KanBan, Agile, Lean, and others. Over the past few years I have been developing my knowledge around product development and strategy, focusing on User Experience and leveraging analytics to make data driven decisions that users care about. I have served as both a lead engineer and a development director, deriving my leadership from my experience and credibility, rather than blind authority.

Projects

  • The Sum

    Interactive site for The Sum creative conference in San Francisco. Worked with the design director to build a responsive site providing beautiful and interative UI elements while maintaining simple and easy to navigate information architecture.

    JS, CSS

  • The Bold Italic

    Online Magazine complete UI redesign that included major shifts in underlaying application architecture. Implemented new, custom layouts and migrated archived content to those layouts. Worked directly with design director to accommodate cutting edge UI components.

    Ruby on Rails, JS, CSS

  • G+ Interactive Post Creator

    Simple tool to create an Interactive Post without implementing code on a page. This was previously only possible via a minimally documented API, and this app allowed anyone to create these post types on Google Plus.

    JS, CSS
    Google+ Interactive Post JS API

  • Graph Guru

    Comparison tool for analytics (Insights) on Facebook Business Page Posts from the last 30 days. Tool allows the display and sorting of metrics for each post as well as a "score" that can have it's formula modified by the user.

    PHP, JS, CSS
    Facebook Graph API

  • SF Cranes

    Web app for marking the location of tower cranes in San Francisco. A user can either allow the detection of their current location or mark a location manually.

    Ruby on Rails, JS, CSS
    Google Maps JavaScript API

Experience

  • Development Director @ The Bold Italic, Gannett

    San Francisco, Ca - Nov 2013 to present

    • Built and launched a complete redesign of the website in mid-2014 with entirely new article layouts.
    • Managed technical team of 2-4 web developers.
    • Worked directly with stakeholders to develop strategies, expectations, and goals for each project.
    • Managed product roadmap and was responsible for coordinating with design, project managers, developers, and executive management.
    • Front-end development for projects that required unique or custom interfaces.
    • Lead development on external projects for customers and discovery on all non-platform applications.

  • Software Architect @ ShopIgniter

    San Francisco, Ca & Portland, Oregon - Apr 2011 to Nov 2013

    Positions held: Software Architect, Lead Engineer of Service APIs, Senior Software Engineer

    • Worked with Sales, Customer Service and Engineering to build prototypes of new application functionality or run tests on technical limitations.
    • Architectured and lead building & testing of 8 service APIs to distribute resources and business logic throughout the system.
    • Educated teams on TDD and DDD methodologies.
    • Worked directly with Executive leadership to plan development schedules and product releases.
    • Evangelized internally for our application architecture.

  • Founder @ Trees By Bike

    Portland, Oregon â€“ Seasonal, 2009 to 2011

    • Managed marketing, sales and fulfillment of hundreds of trees throughout the Portland-metro area.
    • Worked directly with customers, tree distributors, delivery riders, charitable organizations and press.
    • Grew business revenue and team substantially all three years.
    • Notable media coverage both locally and internationally.
    • Maintained very high regard and satisfaction from all customers.
    • Contributed 10% of revenue to local charities.

  • Web Developer @ Roundhouse Agency

    Portland, Oregon - Mar 2010 to Oct 2010

    • Developed a custom, private social network platform built on the Wordpress/Buddypress CMS.
    • Supported daily requests from clients for website maintenance and feature build-outs.
    • Worked within a large team of Art Directors, Designers, Project Managers, and Customer Service.

  • Web Developer @ Entercom

    Portland, Oregon - Aug 2008 to Mar 2010

    • Built and maintained a large CMS blog for over 60 different station websites.
    • Supported on-call web development for national and local divisions of the company.
    • Communicated with different teams about projects in a large & layered organization, working with both localized web masters and corporate management.

  • Web Developer @ Right Brain Resource (acquired by NexSys Group)

    Portland, Oregon - Feb 2008 to Aug 2008

    • Restructured job recruitment community site and implemented multiple new features for resume upload and personal information editing.
    • Developed, implemented and modified templates for weekly newsletter modifications and smaller features for regular events.

  • Creative Team Lead @ Entercom

    Portland, Oregon - Jul 2007 to Feb 2008

    • Designed marketing campaigns for clients, utilizing both visual design and web.
    • Fulfilled all internal design and development needs for web, print, and video.
    • Worked with the dedicated web developer to build large projects for content management and online client proposals.

  • Production Manager @ Celesto Technology

    Irvine, Ca - May 2006 to Jul 2007

    • Managed and worked alongside numerous designers and developers on projects.
    • Developed task/issue and reporting system for custom service orders.
    • Improvised QA for all out-sourced contractor work.
